business.headline: Your bank says you need home loan insurance. But is it really mandatory?Banks often push insurance at the final stage of a home loan, leaving many borrowers unsure of what they must agree to. Is it actually mandatory to take that insurance?

IRFC shares jump 5%: Why is the railway stock rising today?Shares of Indian Railway Finance Corporation Ltd, also known as IRFC, have been rebounding after a long correction. The stock had touched a record high of Rs 229 in July last year.

Will the 8th Pay Commission bring a 20–35% salary hike for government employees?With the 7th Pay Commission ending in December 2025, are government employees now headed for a 20–35% salary hike under the 8th Pay Commission? Let's understand here.

Got a strict ITR mismatch message from the tax department? Here's what it meansThe communication has caused anxiety because of its wording, which tells taxpayers that not responding "may be construed as a deliberate choice" and that such cases may be taken up for detailed investigation.

How to build portfolios that survive market stormsMarket risk is far more visible than other risks on account of associated volatility, leading investors to confuse safety with low volatility. A stable investment can also quietly erode wealth if it fails to beat inflation or lacks liquidity.

Explained: Why Belrise Industries share price rose 13% todayBelrise stock: The share price moved higher after a large block deal took place and after the company announced a new strategic partnership in the defence space.
Why do your financial plans fail even when markets perform well?Strong markets should mean stable financial plans. So why do many plans fall apart? Here's what often goes wrong.

ITR refund put on hold? Here's what's actually going onThe growing wait for refunds has left taxpayers looking for answers, and the real question is what exactly has changed this year to make the process feel slower than most expected.

IRCTC out of F&O from February 2026. What it means for tradersWith IRCTC set to move out of the F&O segment next year, the real question now is how the stock will trade once derivatives dry up and only cash-market cues remain.

Is it too late to buy gold, silver as prices hit record high?With gold and silver smashing past every previous record, the question now is whether this rally still has fuel left, or if investors risk entering just as the momentum begins to fade.

Bourbon maker Jim Beam halts production at flagship distillery for one yearJim Beam is owned by Suntory Global Spirits, a Japanese drinks group that employs more than 1,000 people across its locations in Kentucky. The company said that its other operations in the state will continue to function as normal.

Gold, silver hit record highs: What's driving the rally and should you buy now?A year that began with steady caution is ending with investors sprinting back to precious metals, turning gold and silver into the market's loudest signal of global unease.

Ambuja Cements shares jump 2% today. Here's why it's risingThe Ambuja Cements stock opened firm and held its momentum, signalling that the Street is clearly buying into the long-term strategic repositioning that the Adani Group is attempting in its cement business.

Sensex, Nifty open slighly lower in early trade as IT stocks fallThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 58.36 points at 85,509.12 around 9:22 am, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 20.20 points to 26,152.20. Most broader market indices also traded marginally lower.

National Farmers Day 2025: Top 10 schemes supporting farmers across IndiaOn National Farmers Day 2025, it is important to understand the key central government schemes that continue to support farmers with income support, insurance, credit, infrastructure and technology.

KSH International IPO listing: GMP shows weak debut. Check expected share priceKSH International Limited was subscribed 0.87 times by the end of bidding period. This weak demand is reflected in the grey market premium, which points to a discounted debut on listing day.

Why has the Income Tax Department set up a 24x7 control room in Maharashtra?Citizens have been encouraged to share information related to the use of black money, cash distribution, valuables or other forms of inducement used for election campaigning.

Gaming to travel spends: What changes for ICICI credit card users in 2026ICICI Bank credit cards are changing in 2026, reshaping how users spend on gaming, travel and lifestyle purchases as new fees and capped rewards come into play.
Sensex ends 638 points higher, Nifty above 26,100; Trent up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 638.12 points to close at 85,567.48, while the NSE Nifty50 added 206 points to end at 26,172.40.

Trying to get a bank locker? Here's why you may be turned awayIndia currently has around 60 lakh bank lockers, while demand is projected to rise to nearly 6 crore by 2030, according to industry estimates.

entertainment.headline: What is The Odyssey? The epic Greek tale behind Christopher Nolan's next film Christopher Nolan's upcoming film The Odyssey, based on Homer's epic poem, features Matt Damon, Tom Holland, Anne Hathaway, Zendaya, and others.

Kiara Advani joins 8-hours work debate, stresses mental well-being after motherhood Kiara Advani spoke out on the ongoing debate about working hours in Bollywood, focusing on the importance of mental health and balanced work environments.

Looks like he's stepping out of life: RGV praises Akshaye Khanna in Dhurandhar Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma has praised Akshaye Khanna's portrayal in Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar, highlighting the actor's authentic approach.

Dhurandhar actor Naveen Kaushik says part 2 to be 50 times bigger in action, mystery Actor Naveen Kaushik teased a much bigger and more intense in Dhurandhar: Part 2. The actor revealed that the second part, set to release in March 2026, will scale up the action, mystery and manipulation "by 50".

Dhurandhar actor was shocked by brutal torture scene, wondered how it was allowed Naveen Kaushik, who stars in Aditya Dhar's film Dhurandhar, shared his experience of the intense scenes and the extensive set design. The actor reflected on the realism and scale of the production, and some of the film's violent sequences.

When Ghajini almost starred Salman Khan before becoming Aamir Khan's blockbuster Producer Boney Kapoor shared that the Hindi remake of Ghajini was initially planned with Salman Khan in the lead before Aamir Khan came on board.

Delhi High Court grants R Madhavan protection over personality rights The Delhi High Court has granted interim protection to R Madhavan and other celebrities, ordering the removal of objectionable content and restraining unauthorised commercial exploitation of their identities, as concerns about AI-generated material and online misuse increase.

James Cameron calls Amy Poehler's 2013 Golden Globes joke about him an ignorant dig James Cameron has expressed disapproval of Amy Poehler's joke made during the 2013 Golden Globes and addressed issues surrounding his contribution to the screenplay of Point Break.

Janhvi, Khushi Kapoor's Christmas celebration has a touching Sridevi connection A video of Janhvi and Khushi Kapoor decorating their Christmas tree is going viral. It features the actors putting ornaments shaped like their parents, Boney Kapoor and the late Sridevi. The video was shared by Orry on his social media account, along with other photos.

Did Aahana Kumra, Danish Pandor go Insta-official on his birthday? Aahana Kumra's recent Instagram post for Danish Pandor's birthday, featuring intimate photos and heartfelt wishes, has prompted widespread speculation among fans about their relationship status.

Gulshan Devaiah says he was taken aback by Samantha-Raj wedding: Had no idea Actor Gulshan Devaiah, who is set to make his Telugu debut with Maa Inti Bangaram, shared that he was unaware of Samantha Ruth Prabhu and Raj Nidimoru's wedding while shooting the film.

No frith or froth: Amitabh Bachchan reviews grandson Agastya Nanda's Ikkis Amitabh Bachchan shared an in-depth review praising his grandson Agastya Nadna's performance and the film's direction. He also reflected on his personal journey as a grandfather witnessing this milestone.

Chinmayi blasts Telugu actor Sivaji for unsolicited advice on women's dressing Actor Sivaji commented on female actors' dressing sense at a film event, saying they should wear what he felt was modest clothing. Singer Chinmayi slammed him for using slurs and called him out for his entitled attitude.

Stranger Things 5 finale runtime revealed: Check out length of final episodes Stranger Things Season 5 Volume 2 arrives on Netflix in India on December 26, 2025. The concluding three episodes total nearly three and a half hours, offering a cinematic experience.

Michael Douglas opens up on talking to Rob Reiner about sons' drug struggles Michael Douglas discussed how his experience with his son Cameron's addiction helped him connect with Rob Reiner on CBS's Rob Reiner – Scenes from a Life special. The latter's son, Nick, has been arrested in connection with his parents' deaths.

50 Cent trolls Stranger Things saying his Diddy docuseries beat Netflix sci-fi hit Rapper and producer 50 Cent claimed in a now-deleted post that his Netflix documentary series Sean Combs: The Reckoning has beaten Season 5 of the platform's flagship programme Stranger Things.

When Madhuri Dixit was told to fix her nose to look like a star Madhuri Dixit has revealed in a recent interview that she faced unsolicited remarks about her appearance early in her career, but overcame these challenges with family support and professional success.

Kareena-Saif get into Christmas spirit with Soha, decorate tree with Taimur, Inaaya The Pataudi family comes together to begin Christmas celebrations, as Kareena Kapoor, Saif Ali Khan, Soha Ali Khan, and Sharmila Tagore join the children in decorating a festive tree.

Lokah director discusses film's 'unexpected' success, shares update on Part 2 Director Dominic Arun reflected on the box office impact of Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra, confirmed scripting progress for the next installment, and addressed the creative pressures following the film's success.

general news.headline: Protest outside Bangladesh mission over Dipu Das's lynching, barricades toppledThe protest, carried out by members of the Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) and other Hindu organisations, turned violent as demonstrators toppled police barricades and clashed with security personnel.

Aravalli Hills: The answers, half answers and non-answers of Bhupender YadavAravalli Hills row: Under fire from activists and amid a social media storm alleging that vast tracts of the Aravalli Hills may be opened to mining, Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav faced an uphill task of addressing concerns. Here's a look at how the government fared in clarifying the allegations.

Odisha under fire after buying Rs 12-crore modified Thars for forest rangersThe Odisha Forest Department's procurement and costly modification of the Thar SUVs has sparked widespread criticism, prompting an official audit to review the spending and approval process for these expenditures.

Hindu family's home torched in Bangladesh, note threatens community: Final warningBangladesh protests: All family members managed to escape in the nick of time by cutting through the fence. However, their household belongings were destroyed in the fire and their pets were burnt to death.

Life in Afghanistan: Rashid Khan says he uses bulletproof car in hometownRashid Khan said he needs a bulletproof car to travel in Afghanistan, leaving Kevin Pietersen shocked during an interview. Rashid, who spends most of his time in Dubai, is one of the most popular cricketers from the country.

Chopped into pieces, stuffed in bag: UP woman, lover murder husbandA woman in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal reported her husband missing. Twenty-seven days later, police recovered a decomposed torso bearing a 'Rahul' tattoo, alerting them that something was amiss -- and ultimately helping crack a gruesome murder case.

Akhlaq lynching: Court rejects UP government's 'frivolous' plea to withdraw caseDuring the hearing, the court observed that the plea moved by the prosecution lacked merit and was without any solid legal basis. Terming the application "irrelevant and baseless," the court dismissed it.

US alert for H-1B and H-4 applicants amid visa renewal delays. What it meansThe US government on Monday issued an alert saying that its foreign missions had expanded online presence reviews to all applicants as part of standard visa screening. This is what the new alert means for H-1B and H-4 applicants amid a delay in visa interviews.

IFS officer issues warning after red fox spotted in Ladakh's Pangong lakeThe video shared by Instagram user Vibhor Srivastava showing a red fox roaming near Pangong Tso in Ladakh has gone viral. IFS officer Parveen Kaswan has shared an advisory regarding it.

Part 2: How Bengaluru woman taught a lesson to society 'uncles' for harassing herA 22-year-old woman living alone in what she described as one of the most prestigious societies in her city has initiated legal proceedings after an incident involving members of the housing society board.

Got a strict ITR mismatch message from the tax department? Here's what it meansThe communication has caused anxiety because of its wording, which tells taxpayers that not responding "may be construed as a deliberate choice" and that such cases may be taken up for detailed investigation.

ML Sharma, Nirbhaya case lawyer, dies; mastered art of publicity interest litigationFrom defending the accused (later convicted) in the Nirbhaya gang-rape case to filing publicity PILs in cases like the coal-block-allocation scam and the Pegasus snooping allegations, ML Sharma was one of India's most controversial lawyers. The serial petitioner, whose pleas were often dismissed by the Supreme Court, passed away last week.

James Cameron calls Amy Poehler's 2013 Golden Globes joke about him an ignorant digJames Cameron has expressed disapproval of Amy Poehler's joke made during the 2013 Golden Globes and addressed issues surrounding his contribution to the screenplay of Point Break.

India's poll machinery flawed: Rahul Gandhi escalates vote chori claim in BerlinWhile addressing an event in Germany, Rahul Gandhi alleged that the Enforcement Directorate (ED) and Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) were being used by the BJP to target political opponents while sparing those aligned with the ruling party.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 7: Dravida to Dravidian, the Polemics of Imported PunditsTo summarise the story so far: Tamilakam and Tamil were the substratum and the substance. Sanskritic Dravida was the shell that was superimposed. The subsequent adjectivisation of Dravida into Dravidian was not, however, just a semantic substitution; it was a seismic shift — an academic earthquake that fundamentally recalibrated the entire intellectual geography of the Southern Peninsula.

Who gains from Osman Hadi's killing ahead of polls? It's not BNP or Awami LeagueSharif Osman Hadi, spokesperson of Inquilab Mancha and candidate for Dhaka-8 seat, was murdered, plunging Bangladesh into chaos. But who gains from Hadi's killing ahead of the February election? Is it the now-banned Awami League or the BNP that has fielded a heavyweight in Dhaka-8? Or is it Jamaat Shibir?

Why is Saudi Arabia witnessing rare snowfall? Science explainedThe unusual episode once again underlined how climate change is harbouring unusual weather in regions that are far from prepared to handle it.

The Dhurandhar Friday that rewrote Ranveer Singh's storyDhurandhar has altered the box office rhythm of Hindi cinema and rewritten Ranveer Singh's career narrative. The actor who was being written-off for overexposure and misfires, seems to have reclaimed credibility and stardom by stepping back.

Low-quality deal: New Zealand Foreign Minister slams trade agreement with IndiaNew Zealand Foreign Minister Winston Peters said his party was "regrettably opposed" to the trade agreement with India, arguing that it makes "serious concessions" on immigration and investment while failing to secure meaningful gains for New Zealand's key export sectors, especially dairy.

Is it too late to buy gold, silver as prices hit record high?With gold and silver smashing past every previous record, the question now is whether this rally still has fuel left, or if investors risk entering just as the momentum begins to fade.

Bollywood next? Rohit Sharma steals the show in Stranger Things Netflix promoSuperstar cricketer Rohit Sharma features in a clever Netflix promo blending cricket and Stranger Things themes. Several fans on social media have also praised his acting chops, with many joking that the Indian star looks ready for a Bollywood career after retirement.

Aravalli and its ranges: Decoding how India classifies its hills and mountainsHills in the Aravalli Range represent heavily eroded remnants of one of India's oldest fold mountain systems, often classified as such due to their low elevations and rugged, dissected profiles.

Ahaan Panday gets emotional birthday note from Aneet Padda: You were always a starActor Aneet Panday celebrated her Saiyaara co-star Ahaan Panday's birthday with an emotional post. She shared rare personal photos and a touching note reflecting on Ahaan's impact both on and off-screen.

Will 2026 Rajya Sabha battle for 75 seats reshape India's politics?Seventy-five Rajya Sabha seats across several states, including key figures from both ruling and opposition parties, will fall vacant throughout 2026, setting the stage for significant changes in India's upper house of Parliament.

sports.headline: Deepti Sharma becomes No. 1 T20I bowler, Smriti Mandhana slips to No.2 India all-rounder Deepti Sharma has climbed to No.1 in the ICC T20I bowling rankings after her spell against Sri Lanka. At the same time, Smriti Mandhana has slipped to second in the ODI batting list as South Africa captain Laura Wolvaardt reclaimed the top spot.

Sunil Gavaskar first Indian sportsperson to secure personality rights protection Sunil Gavaskar is the first Indian sportsperson to receive court-backed protection for his personality rights. This landmark ruling sets a precedent for athletes seeking legal control over digital misuse of their identity.

Indonesia's Gede Priandana scripts world record with 5 wickets in an over in T20Is Gede Priandana became the first cricketer in T20I history to take five wickets in a single over, powering Indonesia to a dominant victory over Cambodia in Bali. The 28-year-old achieved the extraordinary feat in his very first over of the match, sealing the contest and etching his name into the record books with a new world record.

MS Dhoni the villain? Amit Mishra responds to rumours about his career Former India spinner Amit Mishra recently commented on the popular belief that his career would've been different without MS Dhoni in the Indian team.

Pat Cummins doubtful for T20 World Cup? Australia head coach remains hopeful Australia head coach Andrew McDonald has admitted that Pat Cummins remains a doubtful starter for next year's T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka, describing the fast bowler's prospects as "quite grey" at this stage.

Bollywood next? Rohit Sharma steals the show in Stranger Things Netflix promo Superstar cricketer Rohit Sharma features in a clever Netflix promo blending cricket and Stranger Things themes. Several fans on social media have also praised his acting chops, with many joking that the Indian star looks ready for a Bollywood career after retirement.

England cricketer Andrew Strauss remarries 7 years after death of former wife Ruth Andrew Strauss has remarried seven years after losing his wife Ruth to cancer. The former England captain shared the news quietly, marking a new personal chapter after years devoted to family and charity work.

Life in Afghanistan: Rashid Khan says he uses bulletproof car in hometown Rashid Khan said he needs a bulletproof car to travel in Afghanistan, leaving Kevin Pietersen shocked during an interview. Rashid, who spends most of his time in Dubai, is one of the most popular cricketers from the country.

Virat Kohli's Vijay Hazare clash at Chinnaswamy unlikely to be open for fans: Reports Virat Kohli's return to the Chinnaswamy Stadium is set to be a quiet one. Reports suggest Delhi's Vijay Hazare Trophy clash in Bengaluru will be played behind closed doors due to security concerns.

Alexander Isak's Liverpool chapter handed fresh bump: Forward undergoes surgery Alexander Isak's debut season at Liverpool has been halted by another injury blow. The Swedish striker faces months on the sidelines after undergoing surgery on a fractured ankle and fibula.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi booed by Pakistan fans after India's U-19 Asia Cup loss India's teenage batting star Vaibhav Suryavanshi faced boos from Pakistani fans after a heavy defeat in the Under-19 Asia Cup final. Suryavanshi got dismissed for a quickfire 26 off just 10 deliveries by Ali Raza in the summit clash.

Odisha Athletes Forced Near Train Toilets: Outrage Over 'Inhumane' Trip to UP Wrestling MeetIn a shocking report, 18 young athletes from Odisha were forced to travel in 'inhumane conditions' to the National School Wrestling Championship in Uttar Pradesh. The group, comprising 10 boys and 8 girls, had to sit next to train toilets in freezing winter cold due to a lack of confirmed tickets. The India Today Bureau report highlights that their return journey was equally appalling, with no guardians or safety measures in place. Viral videos of the ordeal have triggered widespread political reactions and public anger, with citizens and organizations like the All India Medical Students Association demanding accountability. The report questions how future champions can be created when 'basic dignity is denied'.

India Women seek more polish, fine-tuning as they face struggling Sri LankaIND vs SL, 2nd Women's T20I: India, buoyed by an eight-wicket victory in the series opener on Sunday, will aim to extend their lead against a struggling Sri Lankan side in the second match on Tuesday.

Stokes' England to be investigated for heavy drinking after Ashes series defeatThe England and Wales Cricket Board has initiated an investigation into reports of excessive alcohol consumption by Ben Stokes and entire England's men's cricket team during their four-day break at Noosa between the second and third Ashes Tests.

Axar Patel to become India's next T20I captain? Former England spinner predictsMonty Panesar believes Axar Patel could be India's next T20I captain after 2026. With Shubman Gill dropped from T20 World Cup and Axar reinstated as vice-captain, the leadership succession debate has gathered momentum.

Pant needs to modify his game or risk getting dropped from team: Amit MishraFormer India spinner Amit Mishra has called on Rishabh Pant to change his batting style to maintain his place in the Indian Test team. Pant's recent poor form and stubborn approach could lead to him being dropped if not addressed, feels Mishra.

Time to speak with the bat: Suryakumar Yadav needs restraint off the fieldOnce a T20I nightmare for bowlers, Suryakumar Yadav now looks ordinary, his words louder than his shots. If India are to defend their World Cup title, the captain must rediscover his old language. Fewer statements, more runs.

Shubman Gill and Suyakumar Yadav's T20 World Cup cases are different: Mohammed KaifMohammed Kaif believes Suryakumar Yadav and Shubman Gill cannot be judged equally in T20s. According to Kaif, proven match-winners deserve extended backing, even during lean phases.

Rasmus Hojlund aims subtle dig at Manchester United after Napoli's Italian Cup winRasmus Hojlund's Instagram post stole headlines after Napoli lifted the Italian Super Cup. The Dane's pointed caption only deepened the contrast between his revival in Italy and Manchester United's ongoing struggles.

DRS: What's next for Shubman Gill after his T20 World Cup 2026 snub?Shubman Gill's snub from the T20 World Cup 2026 squad shocked everyone as the 26-year-old now faces the question of what he needs to do next following this call from the selectors. The DRS panel weighs in on how the Indian ODI and Test captain needs to respond to the setback to come back stronger.

Virat Kohli is a man for the big moments: Dinesh Karthik heaps praise on India starDinesh Karthik has pulled back the curtain on Virat Kohli the person, not just the cricketer. From fierce competitiveness to a love for big moments, Karthik explained why Kohli is built for greatness.

Australia rest Pat Cummins and Nathan Lyon for Boxing Day TestAustralia will walk into the Boxing Day Test without Pat Cummins and Nathan Lyon. With the Ashes already secured, selectors have turned to Todd Murphy and Jhye Richardson to reshape the squad for the fourth Test.

U19 Asia Cup final: Ex-Pakistan captain accuses Indian boys of improper conductFormer Pakistan captain and current coach Sarfaraz Ahmed accused the Indian team of improper conduct during the U-19 Asia Cup final on Sunday, December 21. The fierce contest saw Pakistan secure their second Asia Cup title with a big win.

India U19 team faces review after Asia Cup final debacle vs Pakistan: ReportU19 Asia Cup final: India's disastrous loss against Pakistan in the summit clash of the U19 Asia Cup seems to have drawn the ire of the Indian Cricket Board. According to a Cricbuzz report, BCCI has asked for a performance review from the team management.

These are the heroes: DK's video on Kishan, Samson and Rinku wins heartsFormer India cricketer Dinesh Karthik posted a short video on Instagram reacting to the selections of Rinku Singh, Ishan Kishan and Sanju Samson in India's T20 World Cup 2026 squad. The video won hearts across the internet for the unbridled joy in Karthik's face.

Rohit Sharma to be available for Mumbai's first two VHT ties: ReportFormer India captain Rohit Sharma is expected to be available for selection for the first two matches of the Vijay Hazare Trophy for Mumbai, according to a latest report from PTI.

Odisha athletes' train ordeal: 18 wrestlers made to sit near toilet in freezing coldIn this 'Image of the Day' segment on News Today, watch this shocking story of wrestlers, including 10 boys and 8 girls, who were forced to sit near a toilet on a train in freezing cold as they were travelling to the National School Wrestling Championship in Uttar Pradesh without confirmed tickets.

Indian cricket is a strange place: Gill's T20 World Cup snub stuns UthappaRobin Uthappa expressed his disbelief in seeing Shubman Gill being axed from the Indian squad for the T20 World Cup 2026. Gill and Jitesh Sharma were snubbed with Ishan Kishan and Rinku Singh coming into the mix.

Is England's winless Ashes run in Australia down to mentality? McGrath reactsGlenn McGrath feels that England's winless run in Australia during Ashes is down to mentality. The Aussies have already blanked England in the first three Tests to regain the Ashes.

BCCI announces 2.5x pay hike for domestic women's cricketersThe Indian Cricket Board has given a major pay hike to women's cricketers in the domestic structure. According to the new proposal, women's players will get an appraisal of 2.5 times their current match fees.

King Kazu lives on: 58-year-old Miura set for 41st season as pro footballerVeteran Japanese striker Kazuyoshi Miura, known as "King Kazu," is reportedly preparing to sign for Fukushima United on loan, marking his 41st year in professional football. Miura's career began in 1986.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
